unnormalised: New Delhi: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) has issued an advisory regarding the use of Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) by government employees. The directive, circulated on 12/07/2024, strongly discourages the use of non-approved VPN services, citing potential security risks and data breaches.
normalised: New Delhi: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (M-e-i-t-Y) has issued an advisory regarding the use of Virtual Private Networks (V-P-N-s) by government employees. The directive, circulated on twelfth july two thousand and twenty four, strongly discourages the use of non-approved V-P-N services, citing potential security risks and data breaches.

unnormalised: The advisory highlights concerns about the transmission of sensitive government data through servers located outside of India, potentially violating data sovereignty norms. It recommends utilizing secure, government-approved networks and encryption protocols for all official communications and data access. Employees are urged to familiarize themselves with the Information Technology (Intermediary Guidelines and Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021.

unnormalised: Furthermore, the document clarifies the definition of "Dark Web" activity and its associated risks, particularly regarding the potential for exposure to illegal content and cyber threats. Training sessions are scheduled for 20/07/2024 to educate personnel on best practices for online safety and the identification of phishing attempts and malware.

unnormalised: The move comes as India ramps up its efforts to safeguard critical digital infrastructure and combat cybercrime. Details about approved VPNs and secure browsing practices can be found on the MeitY website, meity.gov.in, or by contacting the Cyber Security Division at csd@meity.gov.in.
